resources.string:
Prerequisites for using Wireless Kit

Wireless kit requirements are given in the table above.

As can be seen, out of four features available, two of them requires EMUI 11 and other two requires at least EMUI 10.1 version, alongside some processor requirements.

If the device you are testing this kit with does not meet these requirements, the Wireless Kit may behave unexpectedly or you may not be able to get the result you had hoped you would get.
You can use the values above to test the app quality. If the response is 0 that means the feedback is successful. Otherwise, the feedback has failed.

You can integrate the Wireless SDK into your app to obtain network QoE services. After network QoE perception is registered with your app, Wireless Kit can periodically report your app\'s network QoE information, including the uplink and downlink air interface delays during data transmission, real-time bandwidth and rate of the uplink and downlink air interfaces, network QoE level assessment, and packet loss rate of the uplink air interface.

You can integrate the Wireless SDK into your app to obtain dual Wi-Fi services. After registering dual Wi-Fi services in the app, you can enable or disable Wi-Fi 2 when connecting to Wi-Fi. After connecting to Wi-Fi 2, you can obtain the connection status, network link attributes, and network port status of Wi-Fi 2.

Apps send information such as transmission lags and transmission statistics to the wireless communication module through Wireless Kit. Therefore, the communication module can make scheduling adjustments accordingly to improve the wireless transmission efficiency for the apps. \n\nFor example, if frame freezing occurs during video streaming on an app, Wireless Kit will receive this issue and report it to the wireless communication module. The communication module will then record the frame freezing information and enhance the transmission capability based on the current network status.
Try with the values from previous page:

Wireless Kit also has two other features. 

Weak signal prediction
Wireless Kit uses machine learning to analyze the cellular network signal quality when a user moves along a fixed route. Based on the learning result, it will predict the time when the user is about to enter an area with poor signals, and the time when the user will move to an area with normal signals. In this way, it helps third-party apps take measures in advance, bringing seamless cellular network experience. 

Wi-Fi high-priority transmission
You can integrate the Wireless SDK into your app to obtain Wi-Fi enhancement services. After the Wi-Fi enhancement services are registered with your app, the Wi-Fi high-priority transmission can be enabled.

For the main page of Wireless Kit, please click the left button.

For official documentation that explains all the features in details, please click the right button.
